title: Better Off
lyrics:
I don't need ya, I don't need ya, darling
You think I'm sitting by the phone and waiting for your call and
I know you think I’m broken hearted
But I don't need all of the shit you started
Fool me once, no, you fooled me twice
Fell for love, man, you were so enticing

Bet it all, tried to roll them dice

Your fake diamonds, so mesmerizing



Ah, Ah, Ah

Driving in a car that I paid for

Ah, Ah, Ah

Thinking that she got a chance that she'll be your

Girl

Man, she's just thinking crazy

Girl

You'll never be his lucky lady



I love it when you call me up

And beg for me to come back home

But, baby, you were acting up

With girls, they hitting up your phone

You're saying that you're so in love

I wonder where your heart has gone

That's when I said I've had enough

I think I'm better off alone



My sister told me, homie, just let him go

He's hiding something inside, that's for sure

If you stick around, girl, you already know

Hiding underground ‘cause the devils afloat

On the surface, you need some help, man

He's a serpent and nothing else, man

Let him go, let him go

Before he

Take it all, take it all



Ah, Ah, Ah

Driving in a car that I paid for

Ah, Ah, Ah

Thinking that she got a chance that she'll be your

Girl

Man, she's just thinking crazy

Girl

You'll never be his lucky lady



I love it when you call me up

And beg for me to come back home

But, baby, you were acting up

With girls, they hitting up your phone

You're saying that you're so in love

I wonder where your heart has gone

That's when I said I've had enough

I think I'm better off alone



Ah, Ah, Ah

Driving in a car that I paid for

Ah, Ah, Ah

Thinking that she got a chance that she'll be your

Girl

Man, she's just thinking crazy

Girl

You'll never be his lucky lady



I love it when you call me up

And beg for me to come back home

But, baby, you were acting up

With girls, they hitting up your phone

You're saying that you're so in love

I wonder where your heart has gone

That's when I said I've had enough

I think I'm better off alone
